summary: This is a stipulation filed in the Southern District of New York in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330). The parties agree that a transcript of a sworn statement taken on November 21, 2005 in West Palm Beach, Florida is a true and accurate copy and may be received as evidence at trial, subject to standard objections.

events.title: Sworn Statement Taken
events.description: A sworn statement was taken in West Palm Beach, Florida. The transcript of this statement is the subject of the stipulation.

events.title: Stipulation Filed
events.description: The prosecution and defense file a stipulation agreeing that the 2005 transcript is authentic and can be received as evidence at trial.

keyFacts: The document is a court stipulation from November 2021 in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330).
The parties stipulate that a transcript of a sworn statement from November 21, 2005, taken in West Palm Beach, Florida, is a true and accurate copy.

The stipulation allows the transcript (marked 3504-009) and the stipulation itself (marked Government Exhibit 1005) to be received as evidence at trial, subject to standard objections like relevance and hearsay.
Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team at the time included attorneys Christopher Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeffrey Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim.
The prosecution is represented by U.S. Attorney Damian Williams and Assistant U.S. Attorneys for the Southern District of New York.
